result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifford Lee Dutton Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Clifford Lee Dutton in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:24 PM. State reminds Court that the defendant has previously waived right to attorney, has mailed the defendant all discovery and plea offer. Dutton agrees and is willing to accept the offer he received. State- resolved - plead G to counts #2 and #3, counts #1 and #4 are dismissed and read in, withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, with conditions of #2 - 1 year in jail, court costs on each count, AODA and follow thru, 200 hours of community service, comply with all other conditions as set forth by P&P. Dutton agrees. Recess to allow the defendant time to fill out plea questionnaire (3:27 PM). Recalled at 4:23 PM, same appearances. Dutton provides court with plea questionnaire. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #4 and explains what a DRI count means. Dutton understands. Dutton pleads G to counts #2 and #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Dutton withholds comment - requests time to report. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years on each count, concurrent with each other, with conditions of: costs on each count - paid thru probation, count #2 - 1 year in FC jail - huber allowed - report by 4:30 PM on or before 10/16/15 - credit for 64 days only if revoked (stipulated) - eligible for community service under 973.03(7), AODA and follow thru, 200 hours of community service (total) - to be completed within the first year of his release from incarceration, any and all conditions as set forth by P&P, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Clifford Lee Dutton in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:16 PM. State defendant appears without counsel as he has waived his right to an attorney. Defendant has PH waiver. Court goes over form with defendant and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to a PH. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Proceed to ARGN. State has filed INFO which mirrors. Defendant waives further reading and enters NG pleas on all charges. Court informs defendant of process at FPT. Bond to be continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Clifford Lee Dutton in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:00 AM. Court asks defendant why he does not have counsel here. Defendant wanted to meet with DA, will represent himself. Court recesses to have defendant fill out waiver of right to attorney. Recalled at 9:28 AM. Same appearances. Court has waiver of right to attorney, goes thru it. Defendant makes statement regarding his non-eligibility for SPD and how a court appointed attorney works, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to attorney, finds he is competent to do so and will allow him to represent himself. Defendant pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 9/30/15. State reminds Court that this matter is a felony case. Court sets aside pleas, continues bond. Defendant will waive time limits. Court sets for PH on 8/27/15 at 1:00 PM.
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

Defendant Clifford Lee Dutton in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:10 AM. Dutton has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Dutton understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, will contact SPD, given court appointed paperwork in Court. Recess to talk to SPD. Recalled at 9:36 AM. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. State - bond - signature bond with no consumption of alcohol, no entry into any taverns or bars. Court- bond - $500 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Court sets for AIA on 8/12/15 at 8:45 AM.
